headline.main: Channel Surfing: 'The Walking Dead's Latest Victim

docs.abstract: "The Walking Dead" opens the season with a surprise victim and a continued commitment to realistic gore that is logical but still could give some viewers pause.
docs.snippet: "The Walking Dead" opens the season with a surprise victim and a continued commitment to realistic gore that is logical but still could give some viewers pause.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Supreme Court ruling has opened the possibility that juvenile offenders serving life sentences might get a second chance — and it has also reopened old wounds.

headline.main: Juvenile Killers and Life Terms: a Case in Point
headline.print_headline: Juvenile Killers And Life Terms: A Case in Point

docs.abstract: Supreme Court ruling to ban life sentences without parole for those under age 18 who are convicted of murder offers hope to more than 2,000 juvenile offenders, but also throws family members of victims into anguished turmoil; situation is illustrated by story of Maurice Bailey, who killed pregnant girlfriend Kristina Grill in 1993 when they were both 15 years old, and whose release Grill's sister Bobbi Jamriska opposes.
docs.snippet: A Supreme Court ruling has opened the possibility that juvenile offenders serving life sentences might get a second chance — and it has also reopened old wounds.

docs.lead_paragraph: A small cafe, in the small city of Elyria, Ohio, is being tested by a tough economy. It is the kind of place where Barack Obama and Mitt Romney each hope that his promise of a restored American dream will resonate.

headline.seo: This Land: Losing Sleep but Not Hope at a Diner in Elyria, Ohio
headline.main: At the Corner of Hope and Worry
headline.print_headline: At the Corner of Hope and Worry

docs.abstract: Dan Barry This Land column examines ways in which Donna's Diner in Elyria, Ohio, has been tested by tough economy in wake of recession; small city in which diner, whose proprietor is Donna Dove, is located is exactly the kind of place, and is facing exactly the kind of challenges and disappointments, where Pres Obama and Mitt Romney hope their promises of restored American dream will resonate (Series: Donna's Diner).
docs.snippet: A small cafe, in the small city of Elyria, Ohio, is being tested by a tough economy. It is the kind of place where Barack Obama and Mitt Romney each hope that his promise of a restored American dream will resonate.

docs.lead_paragraph: A young man leaves his friend at the emergency room and takes off.

headline.seo: In the Case of an Unresponsive Woman, Text Messages Offer Clues

docs.abstract: Lisa Sanders Diagnosis column describes difficult diagnosis of an unconscious young woman who was ultimately found to be suffering from dangerous side effect of drug Ecstasy.
docs.snippet: A young man leaves his friend at the emergency room and takes off.

docs.lead_paragraph: A center in Belfast is expected to draw women from across Ireland, where abortion remains highly restricted.

headline.seo: Abortion Clinic to Open in Northern Ireland
headline.main: Belfast Clinic for Abortions Due to Open
headline.print_headline: Belfast Clinic For Abortions Due to Open

docs.abstract: British nonprofit organization Marie Stopes International says it will open abortion clinic in Belfast, first ever on the island of Ireland, raising fury from anti-abortion campaigners who promise to pressure local politicians to refuse to grant operating license.
docs.snippet: A center in Belfast is expected to draw women from across Ireland, where abortion remains highly restricted.

headline.main: Is it a Good Time to Be a Girl in India?

docs.abstract: Child marriage and domestic violence are high, but literacy is increasing.
docs.snippet: Child marriage and domestic violence are high, but literacy is increasing.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Children are being neglected in policies that appeal to their elders — but they are the ones who will have to pay the bills run up today.

headline.main: Cutbacks and the Fate of the Young
headline.print_headline: Cutbacks And the Fate Of the Young

docs.abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column charges that children are being neglected in policies that appeal to their elders in the upcoming presidential election, even though future generations will have to foot the bills for those choices; says the nation's growing debt needs to be addressed by a broader debate on how to ensure that the next generation of taxpaying adults has a fair shot at prosperity.
docs.snippet: Children are being neglected in policies that appeal to their elders — but they are the ones who will have to pay the bills run up today.
